content: 15 cm divide the sts over 2 dpns with 3 sts on each needle and join to work in the round round 1 knit round 2 k1 kfb k1 repeat 8 sts round 3 knit round 4 k1 kfb repeat until end of round 12 sts round 5-7 knit round 8 k2 kfb repeat until end of round 16 sts round 9-11 knit round 12 k3 kfb repeat until end of round 20 sts redistribute the sts onto 3 dpns needle 1 & 3 now have 5 sts each and needle 2 has 10 sts round 13-15 knit round 16 k4 kfb repeat until end of round 24 sts round 17-19 knit round 20 k5 kfb repeat until end of round 28 sts round 21-23 knit round 24 ssk ssk k6 k2tog k2tog repeat 20 sts remove 1 needle redistribute the sts so that needle 1 & 2 now both have 10 sts each round 25 ssk ssk k2 k2tog k2tog repeat 12 sts change to trunk color round 26 30 knit round 31 purl cast off cut yarn tidy up hole while weaving in end do not shut up bottom hole as it remains open hide end inside tree unless you want to stitch up bottom at very end of finishing finishing photos pg 2 making hanger make a loop with your cast on end and knot it to the top hide end inside of tree embroidery step 1 candles put a long piece of white colored yarn on your tapestry needle enter your needle under the trunk and come out where you want your first candle to go make your candles about 3 or 4 sts high be careful not to stitch the 2 sides together as it will be harder to stuff later my candles are positioned like a pyramid with the longest row at the bottom you may want to secure your last candle in place with a small stitch step 2 flames put a long piece of flame colored yarn on your tapestry needle enter your needle under the trunk and come out at the top of your first candle my flames are done in chain stitch lazy daisy petals i make my flames 1 st high once you have secured your flame in place move your needle to where you want your next flame to go step 3 wreath stitch horizontal green lines under your candles following the same process as your candles stuffing make sure all ends are stuffed up inside your tree for hanging ornament stuff your tree lightly sew up bottom end with cast off end if desire for standing tree stuff more firmly thanks for knitting one of my designs for pattern support just pm me 3 medium & large trees the medium and large tree follow similar instructions with the addition of a few more rounds for the large tree marked in pattern you will also use different needle sizes using your main tree color cast on 8 sts
